item.title: Configure payload logging in the dashboard
item.description: Configure payload logging for a managed ruleset in the dashboardConfigure payload logging for a ruleset in the ruleset configuration page. Open Security > WAF > Managed rules. To configure payload logging for a ruleset you had already deployed in the WAF, select Edit next to the managed ruleset name. To deploy a managed ruleset and configure payload logging, select Configure next to the managed ruleset under Managed Rulesets. At the bottom of the page, select Configure payload logging.

item.title: View the payload content in the dashboard
item.description: View the payload content in the dashboardView the content of the matched rule payload in the dashboard by entering your private key. Open Security > Events. Under Activity log, expand the details of an event triggered by a rule whose managed ruleset has payload logging enabled. Under Payload match, select Decrypt payload log. Enter your private key in the pop-up window and select Decrypt. The private key is not sent to a Cloudflare server.

item.title: Configure payload logging via API
item.description: Configure payload logging for a managed ruleset via APIYou can use the Rulesets API External link icon Open external link to configure payload logging for a managed ruleset. ​â€‹ Configure and enable payload logging To configure: Use the Update rule in ruleset API method to update the rule that executes the managed ruleset. In the configuration of the rule that executes the managed ruleset, include a matched_data object in action_parameters to configure payload logging.
